intro: Stachys eriantha, commonly known as the woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and spikes of purple or violet flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny environments. Stachys eriantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
